projectPurpose: To provide a modern, user-friendly, and feature-rich replacement for the standard Unix/Linux `ls` command-line utility, improving readability and offering additional information through enhanced visuals and advanced features.
mainFeatures: Color-coded output for file types and metadata
Support for symlinks, extended attributes, and Git status
Tree view for hierarchical directory listing
marketPositioning: eza is positioned as a modern, actively maintained, and feature-rich replacement for the ubiquitous `ls` command. It differentiates itself from the standard `ls` by providing enhanced visual output (colors, icons), integrating with development workflows (Git status), offering advanced viewing modes (tree view), and presenting more detailed file information in a user-friendly format. As a maintained fork of the popular but unmaintained `exa`, it aims to be the preferred choice for users seeking an updated and actively developed alternative to the traditional file listing utility, competing in the space of 'next-generation' `ls` commands written in performant languages like Rust.
